fr.sorbonne_u.alasca.physical_data

Interface TimingI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSignalData, ComposedSignalData, SignalData, TimedEntity

    public interface TimingI
extends java.io.Serializable
    The interface TimingI defines operation which are used to retrieve timing information associated to some entity, like the time at which some data has been retrieved or computed.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-11-28

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER
      value used when an exception is raised in accessing the current host.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.time.Duration freshness()
      return the freshness of the timed entity; if only one timing exists, the freshness is the duration between its time stamp and the current instant but when there are many timings, the freshness is the largest between the time stamps and the current time, both to be interpreted under the time reference.
      java.time.Instant getTimestamp()
      return the Instant at which a timed action has been taken that is interpretable by the context.
      java.lang.String getTimestamper()
      return the identity of the time stamper.
      boolean hasHardwareTimeReference()
      return true if the hardware clock of a host is directly used as time stamper, false if it is an accelerated clock that is used.
      java.time.Duration timeCoherence()
      compute the time coherence among the timings; if only one timing exists, as in scalar measures, the coherence is Duration.ZERO, otherwise it is the largest duration between distinct timings (e.g.

      • UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER

        static final java.lang.String UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER
        value used when an exception is raised in accessing the current host.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getTimestamp

        java.time.Instant getTimestamp()
        return the Instant at which a timed action has been taken that is interpretable by the context.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null
        Returns:
        the Instant at which a timed action has been taken.

      • hasHardwareTimeReference

        boolean hasHardwareTimeReference()
        return true if the hardware clock of a host is directly used as time stamper, false if it is an accelerated clock that is used.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if the hardware clock of a host is directly used as time stamper, false if it is an accelerated clock that is used.

      • getTimestamper

        java.lang.String getTimestamper()
        return the identity of the time stamper.

        Description

        The time stamper can be either an IP address (as a string) if hasHardwareTimeReference() returns true or the URI of an accelerated clock if hasHardwareTimeReference() returns false.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null && !return.isEmpty()
        Returns:
        the identity of the time stamper.

      • freshness

        java.time.Duration freshness()
                      throws IncoherentTimestampersException
        return the freshness of the timed entity; if only one timing exists, the freshness is the duration between its time stamp and the current instant but when there are many timings, the freshness is the largest between the time stamps and the current time, both to be interpreted under the time reference.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null
        Returns:
        the freshness of the timed entity.
        Throws:
        IncoherentTimestampersException - when several timed entities with incoherent time stampers are examined.

      • timeCoherence

        java.time.Duration timeCoherence()
                          throws IncoherentTimestampersException
        compute the time coherence among the timings; if only one timing exists, as in scalar measures, the coherence is Duration.ZERO, otherwise it is the largest duration between distinct timings (e.g., for compound measures).

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null
        Returns:
        the time coherence among the timings.
        Throws:
        IncoherentTimestampersException - when several timed entities with incoherent time stampers are examined.
